title: 107_hr3908
content: The Act is titled the "North American Wetlands Conservation Reauthorization Act." It amends the North American Wetlands Conservation Act and includes findings and a statement of purpose. SEC. 3 amends Section 2(a)(1) by changing "and other habitats" to "and associated habitats" and Section 2(b) by updating purposes related to wetland ecosystems. SEC. 4 defines a wetlands conservation project. SEC. 4 amends the definition of wetlands conservation project to include wetland ecosystems and associated habitats. SEC. 5 reauthorizes funding levels for fiscal years 2003-2007. SEC. 6 addresses allocation of funds. SEC. 6 amends the allocation of funds for wetlands conservation projects, adjusting the percentages allocated in paragraphs 1 and 2. Section 8(b) (16 U.S.C. 4407(b)) is amended to require cost sharing for wetlands conservation projects, with non-Federal sources covering a portion of the project costs. Federal funds can cover 100% of project costs on Federal lands. Technical corrections are also made. The North American Wetlands Conservation Act is amended to include specific changes such as inserting references to the Endangered Species Act of 1973 and Secretary of Sedesol for Mexico in certain sections. Additionally, amendments are made to committee references and dates in various sections of the Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the North American Wetlands Conservation Act, including changing references from "Commission" to "Council", updating dates, and adjusting the number of Council members. Amendments are made to sections of the North American Wetlands Conservation Act, including changing references and updating dates. Amendments to the Chesapeake Bay Initiative Act of 1998 change the date from 2003 to 2008.
